issue.title: [Website] Update site to use "official" Apache Arrow logo, add clearly marked links to logo
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5257](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
See logo at https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1qmvPpFU7sdm9l6A6LEyI0zIzswGtJW0Sbd_lfHLaXQs/edit#slide=id.g4258234456_0_1

An unofficial logo lacking the "Apache" has been making the rounds on the internet, so I think it would be a good idea to update our web properties with the approved logo as discussed on the mailing list

Whoever does this task – please make sure to compress the PNG asset of the logo prior to checking in to source control

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16832892) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Which file needs to be updated, <https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/site/img/arrow.png>? I don't see that being referenced in /site in the repository.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16832896) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
And/or should we add official assets to <http://arrow.apache.org/powered_by/>, since that discusses branding?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16832906) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Yes, that image needs to be updated, but I don't think it's used anywhere. I think the Powered By page would be a great place to put the logo, and additionally on the front page

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16832920) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Do you have any other design assets (like an svg version) anywhere? I can make this work with the one from the presentation but it would be better if there were originals. 

I added a transparent background to the image in the presentation (not perfectly) and experimented with sticking it in the top left of the page, where you'd expect it and where other Apache projects tend to put their logo, and it's not awesome. IMO we either should make a white version of the logo/wordmark, change the header not to be dark, or both. 

 

![image-2019-05-03-16-19-05-041.png](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12967821/image-2019-05-03-16-19-05-041.png)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16832928) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I see. `[~kstirman]` can you assist with this since I believe you created this logo originally?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16835767) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
For the website header, we can keep the dark gray background and use a white version of the logo, like this. Thoughts? If you want to keep it black everywhere, I'll need to make revisions to the site theme (not a problem, just confirming).

 

![image-2019-05-08-13-15-53-694.png](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12968212/image-2019-05-08-13-15-53-694.png)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16872656) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
The white logo seems fine. Somewhere we need to give people an obvious path to obtaining the black official logo PNG asset, though

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16872659) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Yeah, I'm planning to use white there and then put the black version on the powered-by page. Planning to do that today actually–sound good?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5257?focusedCommentId=16873807) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 4696
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4696>
